clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Change of Breast Cancer Patients' Upper Limb Lymphatic Drainage Pathway After Operation
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Change of Breast Cancer Patients' Upper Limb Lymphatic Drainage Pathway After Operation

brief_summary.textblock: Lymphoscintigraphy is a noninvasive，accurate and effective imaging modality. In this study, it is used to investigate the imaging characteristics of patients'upper limb lymphatic drainage before operation, and the influence of operation on it.

detailed_description.textblock: The global burden of breast cancer continues to increase largely because of the aging and growth of the world population. More than 1.38 million women worldwide were estimated to be diagnosed with breast cancer in 2008, accounting for 23% of all diagnosed cancers in women. Given that the 5-year survival rate for breast cancer is now 90%, experiencing breast cancer is ultimately about quality of life. Women treated for breast cancer are facing a life-time risk of developing lymphedema, a chronic condition that occurs in up to 40% of this population and negatively affects breast cancer survivors' quality of life. It's becoming more and more important to do more research on the breast cancer-related lymphedema. Axillary reverse mapping (ARM) is a technique used to map arm lymphatic drainage during axillary lymph node dissection (ALND) and/or sentinel lymph node dissection (SLND). It's necessary for the investigators to understand the participants' upper limb lymphatic drainage before operation and what the investigators have done on it during operation. It can be easy to understand the influence of operation on the participants' upper limb lymphatic drainage, the possibility and safety of reserving lymph nodes draining the upper extremity lymph.

primary_outcome.measure: Number and relationship with the sentinel lymph node of lymph nodes containing 99mTc-Dextran injected preoperatively to do upper limb lymphoscintigraphy and resected in the process of the sentinel lymph node biopsy
primary_outcome.description: Patients enrolled undertake upper limb lymphoscintigraphy before sentinel lymph node biopsy(SLNB).The lymph nodes draining upper extremity lymph will contain 99mTc-Dextran and can be detected by γ detector during operation. The number and relationship with the sentinel lymph node can be measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of lymph nodes containing 99mTc-Dextran injected preoperatively to do upper limb lymphoscintigraphy and resected in the process of the axillary lymph node dissection
primary_outcome.description: Patients enrolled undertake upper limb lymphoscintigraphy before axillary lymph node dissection(ALND).The lymph nodes draining upper extremity lymph can be detected by γ detector in the tissue resected and axilla after operation. The number of them can be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pathological result of lymph nodes containing 99mTc-Dextran injected preoperatively to do upper limb lymphoscintigraphy and resected in the process of the sentinel lymph node biopsy
secondary_outcome.description: The pathological result of lymph nodes containing 99mTc-Dextran injected preoperatively to do upper limb lymphoscintigraphy and resected in the process of the sentinel lymph node biopsy will be reported in 5 days after operation

secondary_outcome.measure: Pathological result of lymph nodes containing 99mTc-Dextran injected preoperatively to do upper limb lymphoscintigraphy and resected in the process of the axillary lymph node dissection
secondary_outcome.description: The pathological result of lymph nodes containing 99mTc-Dextran injected preoperatively to do upper limb lymphoscintigraphy and resected in the process of the axillary lymph node dissection will be reported in 5 days after operation

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before operation and 6 months, 1 year, 1.5year, 2 year, 2.5 year, 3 year, 4 year after operation
other_outcome.description: The patients' upper limb circumference will be measured on 1 day before operation and 6 months, 1 year, 1.5year, 2 year, 2.5 year, 3 year, 4 year after operation

arm_group.description: Patients of the group is diagnosed with breast cancer and receive lymphoscintigraphy before operation, and will receive sentinel lymph node biopsy
Patients of the group is diagnosed with breast cancer and receive lymphoscintigraphy before operation, and will receive axillary lymph node dissection

study_pop.textblock: 100 breast cancer patients treated in Peking University People's Hospital Breast Center and agree to receive lymphoscintigraphy of upper extremity.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
For inclusion in the study patients must fulfil all of the following criteria:
1. Diagnosed with breast cancer
2. There is no metastasis except axillary nodes
3. Agree to receive Lymphoscintigraphy of upper extremity
Exclusion Criteria:
Any of the following is regarded as a criterion for exclusion from the study:
1. Pregnancy or lactation
2. Inflammatory breast cancer
3. Disagree to receive Lymphoscintigraphy of upper extremity
4. History of axillary lymph node resection
